column3: The only things I've seen are 4.8 5.3 and versions under 4.8 which we probably dont want to every use.
@gmaxwell i've never actually seen 6.x on any system, but i guess no problem searching for it
But BDB 6 is AGPL, which Bitcoin Core is not compliant with (the node would need to share its own source code to peers somehow).

I've never seen 6.x on a system either. Looks like the license change caused to fail adoption.

utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10803/commits/1cc251f50fb2f9cffa762b28e5d8685af4273663

Edit: at least for ubuntu, bdb 6.0 was never packaged: https://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=libdb&searchon=names&suite=yakkety&section=all . So we'd have no idea in what directory to look
